Viljar Hanssen.Action: Described as a natural leader among his friends.
Successfully handles check-in process at the camp desk in an orderly way.
Greets best friends with a hug and engages warmly with them while preparing for the camp weekend.
Wakes Torje next to him and engages in friendly teasing with Simon about swimming with girls from Finnmark, laughing together as they walk to the canteen.
Wakes Torje and then walks over to check on Simon and Anders, engaging with them and checking the seminar schedule actively.
Asks pointed questions (e.g., 'Swimming? With the enemy?') showing awareness and social engagement.
No clear indication of taking initiative or problem-solving in these excerpts, mostly casual interactions.
Volunteers to start the seminar exercise confidently and articulates a clear, inclusive principle he would stand for as Prime Minister.
Responds thoughtfully in seminar, demonstrating understanding of complex global issues and realistic approach to political challenges.
Checks his phone promptly after hearing about the explosion and heads towards the building with concern.
Shows concern and awareness of the situation but takes no immediate leadership or decisive action in the excerpt.
Reassures his younger brother Torje that their parents are safe and promises to look after him.
Smiles and ruffles his little brother’s hair to comfort him.
Reports critical information quickly and clearly during a crisis situation (reports shooting and danger).
Ends call abruptly without providing further details or taking additional communicative actions.
Musters remaining strength to splash water at Torje, urging him to go and take cover.
Uses uninjured hand to touch and assess his wounds despite severe injury.
Lies on rocks screaming amidst gunfire, with sounds of sobbing and pain nearby, indicating a state of shock and physical incapacity.
Lies motionless with catastrophic injuries, unable to act or respond due to his severe wounds.
Tells a child to run during a shooting, showing presence of mind under extreme stress.
Ends up injured or incapacitated (implied by narrative), unable to continue protecting others.
Is unconscious and in hospital after the attack, no direct action shown
His condition is described by medical professionals; no direct actions or statements by Viljar in the excerpt.
Remains unconscious in ICU, no active behavior displayed in the excerpt.
Tries to communicate and remember details despite pain and medication, shows concern for Torje's wellbeing.
Focuses on facts and the extent of harm without emotional outburst or visible bitterness.
Responds weakly but meaningfully to doctors' commands despite injury and medication, successfully recalls his location (Svalbard).
Struggles to remember details and has slow cognitive processing due to medication and trauma.
Begins to cry upon hearing that Anders and Simon are dead, showing desperation and emotional openness.
Engages in a calm and polite conversation with Lara, showing composed social interaction despite recent trauma.
Refuses to accept smuggled food or cigarettes, indicating self-control and awareness of his needs.
Shows limited emotional expression beyond brief laughter, potentially indicating difficulty processing trauma but still maintaining composure.
Laughs for the first time since the attack, responds sincerely when asked if it hurts to laugh, agrees to have Lara come back to visit him
Laughs for the first time since the attack, shows some emotional resilience.
Admits he needs to be careful due to pain, demonstrating awareness and self-monitoring.
Agrees to let Lara come back, showing openness to support and reasonable social judgment.
Refuses more morphine despite pain, allowing Christin to care for him
Silent and submissive during care
Shows concern by asking about Christin's campaign
Refuses more morphine despite pain, showing self-control and clear-headedness.
Remains silent and submissive while being cared for, indicating low initiative or passivity.
Encourages Christin to take an important election call despite the tense atmosphere.
Shows uncertainty and vulnerability when left alone in the busy corridor, looking around.
Skeptical about using Skype to connect on election night, but willing to consider it.
Addresses viewers with a sincere and hopeful message despite his difficult situation, expressing pride in his mother and hope for reunion.
Battles inner fear and rage silently, showing emotional struggle but no outward hostility.
Engages in friendly banter with Lara before leaving hospital, showing concern for her wellbeing and making a light-hearted challenge about a future race.
Sits quietly in the van next to Torje, who looks away quickly, indicating a lack of overt social tension or conflict initiated by Viljar.
Focuses on packing and preparing to leave, dealing with physical struggle (using a stick), but no explicit social interaction.
Punches mirror in anger, drives snowmobile recklessly, showing inner turmoil and self-destructive behavior but not directing anger outward.
Admits aloud 'I can't live like this! Thinking I'm going to get better. I'm not. It’s all still here. In my head. I can’t get rid of it.' showing emotional honesty and vulnerability.
Walks away from crash but allows parents Christin and Sveinn to approach him, lets Christin hug him, showing some openness to closeness and care.
Refuses to escape from emotional pain, asks 'What the fuck am I supposed to do? Tell me!' expressing need for connection and help rather than shutting others out.
Rides his snowmobile recklessly fast, pushing speed aggressively and daring to crash.
Despite the accident, he walks away from the crash site under his own power.
Expresses emotional vulnerability and admits inability to cope or improve, showing self-awareness but also despair.
Turns off the TV news coverage of the trial, indicating he wishes to avoid painful reminders.
Invites Torje to go into town, showing an attempt to connect or include someone else.
Does not receive a response from Torje, and does not push further or show frustration.
Responds politely and sincerely to Simon’s father, apologizes for not visiting, asks about Simon’s family.
Declines ice-fishing invitation hesitantly, promises to come later, indicating social withdrawal but trying to keep connection.
Leaves while Simon’s father looks disappointed, showing difficulty fully engaging, but does not reject the relationship.
Invites Torje to watch a movie, tries to engage him in conversation despite Torje's reluctance.
Recognizes and insists that Torje can talk to him about feelings and trauma.
Apologizes to Torje for their parents focusing a lot on Viljar’s condition.
Walks away after expressing hope that things will be OK, leaving Torje somewhat unresolved.
Encourages Torje to open up and tries to communicate with him sensitively despite their trauma.
Acknowledges his own injury and vulnerability but still takes initiative to support his brother.
Walks away after an unsuccessful attempt to reach Torje, possibly indicating limits in handling the emotional situation.
Receives a letter from the family lawyer regarding testifying in court and contemplates it.
Has a sincere and open conversation with Lara about his fears and doubts regarding testifying at the trial.
Admits his vulnerability and struggle with everyday life after the trauma ('I can’t even walk down the fucking street').
Avoids confrontation or making a definitive decision about testifying immediately, needing time to think.
Receives a letter requesting him to testify at trial and considers the difficult decision, discussing it with Lara and showing awareness of his own emotional state.
Admits to struggling with walking down the street and doubts his ability to face the situation, revealing emotional difficulty.
Training hard, pushing himself to the point of failing.
Being alone and shattered after intense training.
Admits to being shattered and afraid, reveals vulnerability about crying in sleep and fear of death.
Expresses desire for violent revenge against the attacker to make him understand the pain caused.
Refuses to avoid confronting his trauma, insists on speaking about the truth despite fear.
Expresses emotional struggle and admits vulnerability openly, indicating self-awareness but hesitance.
Determines to face the situation by deciding to say a few words despite his fear, showing resolve and a measure of confidence.
Articulates strong emotions and a clear motivation for justice, demonstrating mental clarity and focus.
Asks Torje if he is OK, expresses care.
Walks with Lara, listens and offers supportive comments about her actions.
Does not show visible emotional reaction to Breivik's presence, keeps composed.
Expresses deep sorrow and vulnerability openly, showing tears and talking about missing his friends sincerely.
Acknowledges his pain and brokenness honestly in front of others.
Chooses to focus on family, friends, memories, hopes, and love instead of bitterness.
Maintains unwavering eye contact with Breivik, showing strength but not hostility or hatred.
Navigates to the correct camp area by recognizing and heading towards the Troms & Svalbard camp.
Engages warmly and confidently with friends upon arrival, showing social ease and preparedness.
Relies on parents to pack his sleeping bag rather than doing so himself, indicating some passivity or lack of self-preparation.
Laughs and smiles while participating in a group exercise about being president; emphasizes that Svalbard welcomes people regardless of nationality and values inclusiveness.
Focuses on the principle of inclusiveness and unity despite a small example population, suggesting a friendly and tolerant worldview.
Plays actively and effectively in a football game, scoring goals and being at the heart of the action.
Pulls out his phone promptly and calls his mother to check on the situation and his family.
Calmly reassures his younger brother Torje and decides to help by getting dry clothes.
Relies on information from his parents rather than speculating or acting hastily.
Remains alert and attentive to surroundings as gunfire starts, indicating situational awareness.
No immediate reaction or attempt to take control or respond effectively during initial gunfire.
Tries to calm Torje by downplaying the noise as kids messing around.
Realizes danger and urgently shouts 'RUN!' to warn others.
Grabs Torje and runs to protect himself and others from the shooter.
Initially dismisses loud bangs and screaming as kids messing around, showing misjudgment of the danger.
Realizes the threat when Breivik appears and immediately shouts 'RUN!' and grabs Torje to escape.
Calls to warn others about the shooting, telling them quietly and urgently to stay safe.
Reassures Torje, telling him 'It's going to be ok' during crisis.
Urges Torje to leave him and escape despite his own severe injuries.
Finds a break in the fence and leads others to escape route, scrambles skillfully onto a ledge to evade danger.
Keeps composure and reassures Torje despite extreme danger, showing emotional strength and presence of mind.
Continuously struggles to escape even after being shot multiple times, demonstrating physical determination and resilience.
Commands Torje to flee and uses remaining strength to aid his escape despite his critical injury, exhibiting leadership and courage under pressure.
Lies helpless, tries to call out names but receives no response.
Is being operated on in a hospital, indicating survival through expert medical intervention, but no direct action from Viljar demonstrating competence.
Unconscious in ICU, no direct interaction shown, no warmth-related action present.
Begins to cry in desperate moments upon hearing about Anders and Simon's death.
Allows his parents to stay by his side and holds Christin's hand tightly, showing acceptance of support.
Responds to the lead surgeon's questions with silence and refuses to ask questions.
Requests privacy for a moment alone to process pain and fear.
Responds calmly to grave news about his condition without asking questions.
Asks for a moment alone to process overwhelming emotions and pain.
Expresses sincere sympathy for Lara who lost her sister.
Engages in light, friendly conversation with Lara and laughs for the first time since the attack.
Declines Lara's offer to smuggle food or cigarettes, politely but firmly.
Encourages Christin to take an important election call despite busyness, showing situational awareness and prioritization.
Questions the practicality of using Skype for election night communication, showing skepticism but also awareness of logistical challenges.
Looks uncertain and unsure of what to do in a busy corridor, indicating a moment of hesitation or discomfort.
Shares his vulnerabilities openly with Lara, expresses frustration and fear about his helplessness and flashbacks, and jokes with her to lighten the mood.
Discusses the trauma and the attacker with Lara in a sincere, reflective manner.
Packing his things with a stick, preparing to leave the hospital independently.
Engages in friendly, confident conversation with Lara, including setting goals about training and winning a race.
Struggles to walk upon arriving home, indicating physical limitations affecting his capability.
Allows Christin to help with his coat, but insists on doing his shoes himself.
Welcomes Simon and Anders' parents with empathy and embraces them in shared grief.
Insists on doing his shoes by himself despite others offering help.
Expresses frustration and pain openly to doctor, showing honesty about his condition.
Cuts off doctor impatiently during explanation, indicating irritability.
Flinches, showing vulnerability and fear after hospital visit.
Watches his mother leave without showing distress or confusion, responds with a calm 'Yeah' when asked if he is OK.
Turns on the TV to follow the court proceedings attentively.
Observes Breivik’s Nazi salute calmly and attentively, indicating awareness and composure.
Attempts to walk unaided despite weakness, showing determination and sincerity in his rehabilitation goals.
Sets a clear, ambitious physical rehabilitation goal despite his weakness and unsteadiness, asking the doctor what he needs to do to walk unaided in eight weeks.
Stands alone, calmly prepares to leave, checks on Torje to confirm he is OK, takes lead going out to car confidently.
Approaches Lara, initiates conversation to check on her state after testimony, engages supportively without visible hesitation.
Admits to being lost in the last few months and opens up to Lara about his confusion and vulnerability.
Looks away after making eye contact with Lara, showing some reserve or discomfort.
Expresses concern about not wanting to appear weak in front of Breivik.
Thanks Lara after their hug, showing appreciation and openness to connection.
Admits being confused and 'lost' in the last few months; struggles to prepare what to say and worries about appearing weak.
Prepares himself deliberately by dressing smartly, attending to his appearance, and showing resolve before facing the courthouse.
Paces the lobby alone to steady his breathing, indicating emotional effort and vulnerability.
Shares a moment and a hug with his family before entering the courtroom.
Maintains focus and composure despite the proximity of Breivik, showing self-control under stress.
Tries to control his shaking hands and hold Breivik’s stare, controlling his emotions to testify about traumatic events.
Describes his struggle to protect his little brother during the attack.
Injects dark humor by calling blindness in one eye a relief to avoid looking at Breivik, making others laugh.
Steadies himself and controls his shaking hands before approaching the stand and locking eyes with Breivik despite intense fear and trauma.
Clearly recounts his traumatic experience in a coherent, detailed manner, showing mental resilience and presence of mind.
Acknowledges severe physical impairments candidly and with dark humor, maintaining composure in a highly stressful situation.
Momentarily struggles to keep his voice steady when revealing the danger of a bullet fragment in his brain.
Keeps control under extreme emotional pain, maintains unwavering stare at the perpetrator, chooses to live despite severe trauma.
Becomes tearful and emotionally vulnerable in front of everyone, struggling briefly to maintain composure.
